segment.target: ms.assetid: A1A0D99A-DCBF-4A14-80B9-7106BEF045EC

segment.source: description: You can use the Windows.Media.Transcoding APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.
segment.target: description: You can use the Windows.Media.Transcoding APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.

segment.source: title: Transcode media files
segment.target: title: Transcode media files

segment.source: Transcode media files
segment.target: Transcode media files

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: You can use the Windows.Media.Transcoding APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.
segment.target: You can use the Windows.Media.Transcoding APIs to transcode video files from one format to another.

segment.source: Transcoding is the conversion of a digital media file, such as a video or audio file, from one format to another.
segment.target: Transcoding is the conversion of a digital media file, such as a video or audio file, from one format to another.

segment.source: This is usually done by decoding and then re-encoding the file.
segment.target: This is usually done by decoding and then re-encoding the file.

segment.source: For example, you might convert a Windows Media file to MP4 so that it can be played on a portable device that supports MP4 format.
segment.target: For example, you might convert a Windows Media file to MP4 so that it can be played on a portable device that supports MP4 format.

segment.source: Or, you might convert a high-definition video file to a lower resolution.
segment.target: Or, you might convert a high-definition video file to a lower resolution.

segment.source: In that case, the re-encoded file might use the same codec as the original file, but it would have a different encoding profile.
segment.target: In that case, the re-encoded file might use the same codec as the original file, but it would have a different encoding profile.

segment.source: Set up your project for transcoding
segment.target: Set up your project for transcoding

segment.source: In addition to the namespaces referenced by the default project template, you will need to reference these namespaces in order to transcode media files using the code in this article.
segment.target: In addition to the namespaces referenced by the default project template, you will need to reference these namespaces in order to transcode media files using the code in this article.

segment.source: [!code-csUsing]
segment.target: [!code-csUsing]

segment.source: Select source and destination files
segment.target: Select source and destination files

segment.source: The way that your app determines the source and destination files for transcoding depends on your implementation.
segment.target: The way that your app determines the source and destination files for transcoding depends on your implementation.

segment.source: This example uses a FileOpenPicker and a FileSavePicker to allow the user to pick a source and a destination file.
segment.target: This example uses a FileOpenPicker and a FileSavePicker to allow the user to pick a source and a destination file.

segment.source: [!code-csTranscodeGetFile]
segment.target: [!code-csTranscodeGetFile]

segment.source: Create a media encoding profile
segment.target: Create a media encoding profile

segment.source: The encoding profile contains the settings that determine how the destination file will be encoded.
segment.target: The encoding profile contains the settings that determine how the destination file will be encoded.

segment.source: This is where you have the greatest number of options when you transcode a file.
segment.target: This is where you have the greatest number of options when you transcode a file.

segment.source: The MediaEncodingProfile class provides static methods for creating predefined encoding profiles:
segment.target: The MediaEncodingProfile class provides static methods for creating predefined encoding profiles:

segment.source: Wav
segment.target: Wav

segment.source: AAC audio (M4A)
segment.target: AAC audio (M4A)

segment.source: MP3 audio
segment.target: MP3 audio

segment.source: Windows Media Audio (WMA)
segment.target: Windows Media Audio (WMA)

segment.source: Avi
segment.target: Avi

segment.source: MP4 video (H.264 video plus AAC audio)
segment.target: MP4 video (H.264 video plus AAC audio)

segment.source: Windows Media Video (WMV)
segment.target: Windows Media Video (WMV)

segment.source: The first four profiles in this list contain audio only.
segment.target: The first four profiles in this list contain audio only.

segment.source: The other three contain video and audio.
segment.target: The other three contain video and audio.

segment.source: The following code creates a profile for MP4 video.
segment.target: The following code creates a profile for MP4 video.

segment.source: [!code-csTranscodeMediaProfile]
segment.target: [!code-csTranscodeMediaProfile]

segment.source: The static CreateMp4 method creates an MP4 encoding profile.
segment.target: The static CreateMp4 method creates an MP4 encoding profile.

segment.source: The parameter for this method gives the target resolution for the video.
segment.target: The parameter for this method gives the target resolution for the video.

segment.source: In this case, VideoEncodingQuality.hd720p means 1280 x 720 pixels at 30 frames per second.
segment.target: In this case, VideoEncodingQuality.hd720p means 1280 x 720 pixels at 30 frames per second.

segment.source: ("720p" stands for 720 progressive scan lines per frame.) The other methods for creating predefined profiles all follow this pattern.
segment.target: ("720p" stands for 720 progressive scan lines per frame.) The other methods for creating predefined profiles all follow this pattern.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can create a profile that matches an existing media file by using the MediaEncodingProfile.CreateFromFileAsync method.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can create a profile that matches an existing media file by using the MediaEncodingProfile.CreateFromFileAsync method.

segment.source: Or, if you know the exact encoding settings that you want, you can create a new MediaEncodingProfile object and fill in the profile details.
segment.target: Or, if you know the exact encoding settings that you want, you can create a new MediaEncodingProfile object and fill in the profile details.

segment.source: Transcode the file
segment.target: Transcode the file

segment.source: To transcode the file, create a new MediaTranscoder object and call the MediaTranscoder.PrepareFileTranscodeAsync method.
segment.target: To transcode the file, create a new MediaTranscoder object and call the MediaTranscoder.PrepareFileTranscodeAsync method.

segment.source: Pass in the source file, the destination file, and the encoding profile.
segment.target: Pass in the source file, the destination file, and the encoding profile.

segment.source: Then call the TranscodeAsync method on the PrepareTranscodeResult object that was returned from the async transcode operation.
segment.target: Then call the TranscodeAsync method on the PrepareTranscodeResult object that was returned from the async transcode operation.

segment.source: [!code-csTranscodeTranscodeFile]
segment.target: [!code-csTranscodeTranscodeFile]

segment.source: Respond to transcoding progress
segment.target: Respond to transcoding progress

segment.source: You can register events to respond when the progress of the asynchronous TranscodeAsync changes.
segment.target: You can register events to respond when the progress of the asynchronous TranscodeAsync changes.

segment.source: These events are part of the async programming framework for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and are not specific to the transcoding API.
segment.target: These events are part of the async programming framework for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and are not specific to the transcoding API.

segment.source: [!code-csTranscodeCallbacks]
segment.target: [!code-csTranscodeCallbacks]
